isis.stitle: CAB: 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 7700, 8500 AND 8600 MODELS - REMOVE - EXTENDED CAB BUNK/STORAGE UNIT

svcsubproc.title: Remove Bunk/Storage Unit on Extended Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 8500 and 8600 Models
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 101 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para:
Remove passenger bucket seat or fixed passenger seat, refer to
SEATS
. For removing passenger bucket seat, refer to Remove Passenger Bucket Seat on Standard Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 7700, 8500 and 8600 Models, Extended Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 8500 and 8600 Models and Crew Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500 and 7600 Models. For removing fixed passenger seat, refer to Remove Fixed Passenger Seat on Standard Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 7700, 8500 and 8600 Models, Extended Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 8500 and 8600 Models and Crew Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500 and 7600 Models.

Once the passenger side seat is removed, if so equipped, remove protective plate (Item 1) from both rear passenger seat threaded mounting studs (Item 2) in cab floor. Lay it out of the way and save for installation.
Remove bunk mattress (Item 3) from bunk/storage unit (Item 4). Lay it out of the way and save for installation.
Remove four hex flanged nuts (Item 5), two each end, securing bunk/storage unit (Item 4) to cab floor. Lay them out of the way and save for installation.
Remove two torx head bolts (Item 6) securing seat belts (Item 7) to cab floor. Lay them out of the way and save for installation.
Slide driver side seat all the way forward to allow removal of bunk/storage unit (Item 4).

Lift bunk/storage unit (Item 4) off the four threaded studs in cab floor. Turn bunk/storage unit on it's side and remove from cab through passenger side door opening. Lay it out of the way and save for installation.
